Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky dark brown with faded added white band; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ10
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it comes from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior; given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration. AΦ10 is written in pencil on the sherd's interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1409) (phase 2)
